mil.emp3.api.abstracts

Class Feature<T extends IGeoRenderable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • mil.emp3.api.abstracts.Container
      • mil.emp3.api.abstracts.Feature<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IContainer, IFeature<T>, IGeoAltitudeMode, IGeoBase, IGeoContainer, IGeoPositionGroup, IGeoRenderable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AirControlMeasure, Circle, Ellipse, GeoJSON, KML, MilStdSymbol, Path, Point, Polygon, Rectangle, Square, Text

    public class Feature<T extends IGeoRenderable>
extends Container
implements IFeature<T>
    All single point and multi point shapes and symbols that are displayed on the Map use Feature as their base class. Feature class provides for graphical properties, hierarchy placement and geo spatial positions among other attributes. Feature is a Container and as such it can contain other Features. A Feature can be a child of many other containers and it can have many children. Visibility of a feature is governed by its own visibility and visibility of its parents.

      • apply

        public void apply(java.lang.Object userContext)
        Once application has added a feature to an overlay, it can change one or more attributes of the Feature and invoke the apply method to have those changes reflected on the display. This is typically used to change position(s) as battle field objects move around.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface IFeature<T extends IGeoRenderable>
        Parameters:
        userContext - user defined object

      • apply

        public void apply()
        Once application has added a feature to an overlay, it can change one or more attributes of the Feature and invoke the apply method to have those changes reflected on the display. This is typically used to change position(s) as battle field objects move around.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface IFeature<T extends IGeoRenderable>

      • setStrokeStyle

        public void setStrokeStyle(IGeoStrokeStyle oStyle)
        Sets line style used to render the feature. The line style applies to all features that render lines, borders or outlines. Unless otherwise specified by the specific feature class, the default line style for a feature is a line width of 3 pixels and black color, with no stippling.
        Specified by:
        setStrokeStyle in interface IGeoRenderable
        Parameters:
        oStyle - The new line style to use to render the feature. IGeoStrokeStyle

      • getStrokeStyle

        Specified by:
        getStrokeStyle in interface IGeoRenderable
        Returns:
        The current line style or null if it is not set.

      • setFillStyle

        public void setFillStyle(IGeoFillStyle oStyle)
        Sets fill style used to render the feature. The fill style applies to all features that render as polygons. Unless otherwise specified by the specific feature class, the default fill style for a feature is solid black.
        Specified by:
        setFillStyle in interface IGeoRenderable
        Parameters:
        oStyle - The new fill style. IGeoFillStyle

      • setLabelStyle

        public void setLabelStyle(IGeoLabelStyle labelStyle)
        This method sets the style the text components of the feature are rendered in. The label style is ignored by all features that do not render text components. Unless otherwise specified by the specific feature class, the default label style for a feature is size 12pt, left justified, Regular typeface, Black text with a black outline.
        Specified by:
        setLabelStyle in interface IGeoRenderable
        Parameters:
        labelStyle - IGeoLabelStyle

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer(double buffer)
        A Buffer represents an area around the feature which extends beyond the outer borders of the feature by the distance specified. It is rendered as a shaded area around the feature in the default buffer fill style which has an opacity of 0.5 and a yellow color. in the current version a buffer can be applied to Points, Paths, polygons, rectangles, squares, circles, and ellipses only.
        Specified by:
        setBuffer in interface IGeoRenderable
        Parameters:
        buffer - the distance in meters the buffer extends beyond the outer borders of the feature.

      • getBuffer

        public double getBuffer()
        Get buffer.
        Specified by:
        getBuffer in interface IGeoRenderable
        Returns:

      • setAzimuth

        public void setAzimuth(double dValue)
        This method sets the azimuth value for the feature. The azimuth indicates the clockwise rotation from north at which the feature is to be rendered.
        Specified by:
        setAzimuth in interface IGeoRenderable
        Parameters:
        dValue - - The azimuth in degrees. Valid range is -360 to 360. Out of range values raises an IllegalArgumentException.

      • getAzimuth

        public double getAzimuth()
        Returns Azimuth.
        Specified by:
        getAzimuth in interface IGeoRenderable

      • setPathType

        public void setPathType(IGeoRenderable.PathType pathType)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoRenderable
        Enumeration of path rendering types that affect the way the map will interpret for paths and polygon boundaries. GREAT_CIRCLE - A great circle arc between two locations. LNEAR - Simple linear interpolation between two locations which will paass through ground. It represents the shortest distance between two points passing through the globe. RHUMB_LINE - A line of constant bearing between two locations. Default is GREAT_CRICLE
        Specified by:
        setPathType in interface IGeoRenderable

      • getPathType

        public IGeoRenderable.PathType getPathType()
        Specified by:
        getPathType in interface IGeoRenderable

        Returns the first position on the position list
        Returns:
        The first position on the list or null.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(IGeoPosition oPosition)
        Sets the geographic coordinate of a single point feature. It ensures that there is only one position on the list of positions.
        Parameters:
        oPosition - see IGeoPosition
